definition: a writ from a court commanding police to perform specified acts, stand behind and guarantee the quality, accuracy, or condition of
details:
noun
- a writ from a court commanding police to perform specified acts
- a written assurance that some product or service will be provided or will meet certain specifications
= synonyms: guarantee, warrantee, warranty
- formal and explicit approval
= synonyms: sanction
- a type of security issued by a corporation (usually together with a bond or preferred stock) that gives the holder the right to purchase a certain amount of common stock at a stated price
= example: a type of security issued by a corporation (usually together with a bond or preferred stock) that gives the holder the right to purchase a certain amount of common stock at a stated price
= synonyms: stock warrant, stock-purchase warrant
verb
- stand behind and guarantee the quality, accuracy, or condition of
= example: stand behind and guarantee the quality, accuracy, or condition of
= synonyms: guarantee
- show to be reasonable or provide adequate ground for
= example: show to be reasonable or provide adequate ground for
= synonyms: justify
